metadata.title: CVE-2019-14858 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in Ansible engine 2.x up to 2.8 and Ansible tower3.x up to 3.5. When a module has an argument_spec with sub parametersmarked as no_log, passing an invalid parameter name to the module willcause the task to fail before the no_log options in the sub parameters areprocessed. As a result, data in the sub parameter fields will not be maskedand will be displayed if Ansible is run with increased verbosity andpresent in the module invocation arguments for the task.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14858` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 2.8.6+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ansible package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.8.6+dfsg-1').
